pullRequest.body:
Define Grothendieck categories, i.e. AB5 categories with a separator, in a new separate file and prove that they are complete and cocomplete.

In order to facilitate the proof, the new lemma `hasLimits_of_hasColimits_of_hasSeparator` (a variant of `hasLimits_of_hasColimits_of_isSeparating`) and its dual is introduced in `AdjointFunctorTheorems.lean`.

---

### PR summary [3166f62b02](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18510/commits/3166f62b0257cc70698e56dc8c5076e419e75b54)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Abelian.GrothendieckCategory`|742|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ GrothendieckCategory`
`+ GrothendieckCategory.hasColimits`
`+ GrothendieckCategory.hasLimits`
`+ hasColimits_of_hasLimits_of_hasCoseparator`
`+ hasLimits_of_hasColimits_of_hasSeparator`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Done -- while I was at it, I also added `stacks` attributes to the AB conditions (`GrothendieckAxioms.lean`). More specifically, I referenced [079B](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/079B), which contains the definitions of the AB axioms as well as Grothendieck categories.

```suggestion
class GrothendieckCategory [Abelian C] where
  hasFilteredColimits : HasFilteredColimits C := by infer_instance
  ab5 : AB5 C := by infer_instance
  hasSeparator : HasSeparator C := by infer_instance
```
Then, these fields have to be declared as instances. Then, when proving results about Grothendieck abelian categories, we can start with `variable (C : Type u) [Category.{v} C] [GrothendieckCategory C]`.

When #19200 is merged, I would suggest you use the following definition:
```lean
-- universe w v u
class IsGrothendieckAbelian : Prop where
  locallySmall : LocallySmall.{w} C := by infer_instance
  hasFilteredColimitsOfSize : HasFilteredColimitsOfSize.{w, w} C := by infer_instance
  ab5OfSize : AB5OfSize.{w, w} C := by infer_instance
  hasSeparator : HasSeparator C := by infer_instance
```
Here, there is an auxiliary universe `w`. The first thing to prove would be that under `IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w} C`, we can prove ` IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w, w} (ShrinkHoms C) `. The idea is that under certain circumstances (e.g. étale sheaves), the morphisms in `C` (which are in `Type v`) shall we `w`-small (for a small universe), and we would like to get the good properties of Grothendieck abelian categories for such categories. Roughly speaking, a category satisfying `IsGrothendieckAbelian.{w}` is a category that is equivalent to a category (with `Category.{w}`) that is Grothendieck abelian for your definition.
In order to develop the API, it may be convenient to prove first some results under the favourable assumption `w = v`, and then we may transport properties using the equivalence of categories `ShrinkHoms.equivalence.{w} C`.

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Abelian/GrothendieckAxioms): introduce grothendieck categories
